pr_title: Fix #112: Quarkus Error while trying to build the image: Unexpected internal error near index 1

timeline.bodyText:
Try to use Java native ways to achieve the same purpose.
If I understand correctly, we're trying to create the directory containing the file specified in the targetFileName variable.
This can easily be achieved with: new File(targetFileName).getParent().mkdirs(), no need to reinvent the wheel or create so many helper class methods (there are also alternatives using the new java.nio.file).
I also see that this targetFileName should always point to a file within a directory > don't see a valid compliant use-case having this variable set to something like /archive.tar especially on *nix systems > pathParts.length > 0 shouldn't be optional.
timeline.author: manusa

timeline.bodyText:
BTW, this comment is not accurate.
You have to re-escape the \ character because String#split accepts a regex and \ is the escape sequence for Java regular expressions, so you have to re-escape it.
